required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Spiriva Observational Study Measuring Saint George's Respiratory Questionnaire (SGRQ) in Routine Medical Practice in Central & Eastern European Region
clinical_study.official_title: Spiriva Observational Study Measuring Saint George's Respiratory Questionnaire (SGRQ) in Routine Medical Practice in Central & Eastern European Region

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this observational study is to collect and evaluate data on Health Related Quality of Life (HRQoL) of Spiriva delivered by HandiHaler, using disease specific SGRQ in the national samples of Central & Central European patients with varying severities of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) in the real life setting over the 6 months.

detailed_description.textblock:
Study Design:
an open-label, uncontrolled and single arm post-marketing surveillance study

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change of Total Saint George Respiratory Questionnaire (SGRQ) Score at the End of the Observational Period After 6 Months From Baseline
primary_outcome.description: The SGRQ ranges from 0 (no impairment of quality of life) to 100 (highest impairment of quality of life)

secondary_outcome.description: Pulmonary medication from baseline to visit 3 (6 months)
Patients are considered to be compliant if the difference of the number of days between visit 1 (baseline) and visit 3 (6months) and the number of actual taken capsules is less than 10.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- 40 years and older male and female ambulatory outpatients.
- Clinical diagnosis of Chronic Obstructive Lung Disease (COPD) (Global Initiative for Chronic Obstructive Lung Disease (GOLD) Guidelines: Forced expiratory Volume in one second (FEV1)/ Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) < 0.7 and FEV1 < 80% predicted).
- Stable patient, without exacerbation for at least one month to the study.
Exclusion criteria:
- Uncooperative patients as judged by the physician.
- Patients that have any condition which, according to the participating physician's opinion, might decrease the chance of obtaining satisfactory data to achieve the objectives of the observation study.
- Patients with any conditions excluded as per Country specific package insert.
- Patients currently enrolled in another clinical trial which requires a change in medication for their respiratory problems.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Whilst 4854 patients were enrolled in the study, only 4852 of these entered and were included in the treated set, since two patients had no evidence of Spiriva administration.

group.title: Patients Treated With Spiriva
group.description: Treatment with 18 mcg tiotropium inhalation capsules of Spiriva

group.title: Patients Treated With Spiriva
group.description: Treatment with 18 mcg tiotropium inhalation capsules of Spiriva

measure.title: Age
measure.description: There were only 4779 patients with a non-missing age.

outcome.title: Mean Change of Total Saint George Respiratory Questionnaire (SGRQ) Score at the End of the Observational Period After 6 Months From Baseline
outcome.description: The SGRQ ranges from 0 (no impairment of quality of life) to 100 (highest impairment of quality of life)
outcome.population: Patients from the treated set (TS) who have evaluable SGRQ measurements at baseline and Visit 3 (6 months)

group.title: Patients Treated With Spiriva
group.description: Treatment with 18 mcg tiotropium inhalation capsules of Spiriva

measure.title: Mean Change of Total Saint George Respiratory Questionnaire (SGRQ) Score at the End of the Observational Period After 6 Months From Baseline
measure.description: The SGRQ ranges from 0 (no impairment of quality of life) to 100 (highest impairment of quality of life)
measure.population: Patients from the treated set (TS) who have evaluable SGRQ measurements at baseline and Visit 3 (6 months)

outcome.title: Additional Bronchodilator or Inhaled Corticosteroids (ICS)
outcome.description: Pulmonary medication from baseline to visit 3 (6 months)
outcome.population: Patients from Full Analysis Set (FAS) which includes all patients from the TS who were assessed after administration of Spiriva, i.e. who have evaluable SGRQ measurements at visit 2 or visit 3.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Any publication of the result of this trial must be consistent with the Boehringer Ingelheim publication policy. The rights of the investigator and of the sponsor with regard to publication of the results of this trial are described in the investigator contract.
